title: Changes for soccer, softball announced by IGHSAU
text:
Changes for soccer, softball announced by IGHSAU Published: Friday, Oct. 23, 2015 11:18 a.m. CDT By Newton Daily News 
WEST DES MOINES — Changes for high school girls’ soccer and softball were announced Wednesday by the Iowa Girls High School Athletic Union. 
The IGHSAU Board of Directors approved a change in soccer classifications at its Wednesday meeting. It also approved a recommendation from the IGHSAU Softball Advisory Committee on regional final softball games. Both changes take effect for the 2016 seasons. 
Beginning with the 2016 soccer season, Class 3A will consist of the 40 largest soccer schools. the next largest 48 schools will be 2A, while the remaining schools will play in 1A. Prior to this change, 3A consisted of the 32 largest soccer schools while 2A consisted of the next largest 48. 
A tentative soccer classification will be posted on the IGHSAU website soon. 
The 2016 regional final softball games in all classes — 1A through 5A — will be played on the home field of the highest-seeded team remaining in the regional. 
In order to secure the privilege to host, sites must have adequate lighting and meet certain other minimum facility requirements. 
According to the IGHSAU, the softball advisory committee and board of directors believes this is positive step, which will increase excitement and attendance at these state qualifying games.
